00054 #include "mTouch.h"
00055 #include "mComm.h"
00056 
00057 #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLED)
00058 
00059     //========================================================================
00060     // GLOBAL VARIABLES
00061     //========================================================================
00062     #if defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00063     mComm_OutputVector  mComm_output;
00064     mComm_InputBuffer   mComm_input;
00065     #endif
00066     
00067     #if defined(MCOMM_ONE_WAY_ENABLED)
00068     #if (MCOMM_UART_1WAY_MODULE == MCOMM_UART_SOFTWARE_IMPLEMENTATION)
00069     bank0 uint8_t       mComm_shiftReg;
00070     bank0 uint8_t       mComm_bitCount;
00071     bank0 uint8_t       mComm_delayCount;
00072     #endif
00073     #endif
00074     
00075     //========================================================================
00076     // FUNCTION PROTOTYPES
00077     //========================================================================
00078         void    mComm_Init              (void);
00079

00082         void    mComm_Process           (uint8_t);

00087         void    mComm_UART_PutChar      (uint8_t);
00088     #if defined(MCOMM_ONE_WAY_ENABLED)

00096     
00097     /*********************************************************************************
00098     *             ____                              ___       _ _   
00099     *  _ __ ___  / ___|___  _ __ ___  _ __ ___     |_ _|_ __ (_) |_ 
00100     * | '_ ` _ \| |   / _ \| '_ ` _ \| '_ ` _ \     | || '_ \| | __|
00101     * | | | | | | |__| (_) | | | | | | | | | | |    | || | | | | |_ 
00102     * |_| |_| |_|\____\___/|_| |_| |_|_| |_| |_|___|___|_| |_|_|\__|
00103     *                                         |_____|  
00104     *
00105     *   Initializes the variables and communication module registers to prepare for 
00106     *   the first packet to be sent/received.
00107     *********************************************************************************/
00108     void mComm_Init()
00109     {    
00110         //===========================
00111         // Variable Initialization
00112         //===========================
00113         #if defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00114             mComm_input.index           = 0;                //===========================
00115             mComm_input.counter         = 0;                // Initialize input buffer
00116             mComm_input.checksum        = 0;                //===========================
00117             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_IMPLEMENTED) || defined(MCOMM_SPI_IMPLEMENTED)
00118             mComm_input.state           = 0;
00119             #endif
00120             mComm_input.flags.all       = 0x00;
00121             
00122             for (int8_t i = MCOMM_INPUTBUFFER_SIZE-1; i >= 0; i--)
00123             {
00124                 mComm_input.buffer[i]   = 0;
00125             }
00126         
00127             mComm_output.flags.all      = 0x00;             //===========================
00128             mComm_output.counter        = 0;                // Initialize output buffer
00129             mComm_output.latch          = 0;                //===========================
00130             mComm_output.iterator       = 0x0000;
00131             mComm_output.vector.pointer = 0x0000;
00132             mComm_output.vector.length  = 0;
00133             
00134             
00135             #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM)
00136             #if defined(MCOMM_STREAM_EN_ON_POR)
00137             mComm_streamConfig.enabled  = 1;                //===========================
00138             #else                                           // Initialize stream feature
00139             mComm_streamConfig.enabled  = 0;                //===========================
00140             #endif
00141             mComm_streamConfig.go       = 0;                
00142             mComm_streamConfig.index    = 0;                
00143             #endif
00144         #endif
00145         
00146         //===========================
00147         // Hardware Initialization
00148         //===========================
00149         #if defined(MCOMM_UART_IMPLEMENTED)
00150         
00151             #if (MCOMM_TYPE == MCOMM_UART_ONE_WAY) && (MCOMM_UART_1WAY_MODULE == MCOMM_UART_SOFTWARE_IMPLEMENTATION)
00152             
00153                 //==============================
00154                 // Software UART Initialization
00155                 //==============================
00156             
00157             asm("BANKSEL    "   ___mkstr(       MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPORT));
00158             asm("bsf        "   ___mkstr(NOBANK(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPORT)) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));
00159             
00160             asm("BANKSEL    "   ___mkstr(       MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXTRIS));
00161             asm("bcf        "   ___mkstr(NOBANK(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXTRIS)) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));
00162             
00163             #else
00164             
00165                 //==============================
00166                 // Hardware UART Initialization
00167                 //==============================
00168                 
00169             MCOMM_UART_TXSTA    = 0;   
00170             MCOMM_UART_RCSTA    = 0;    
00171             MCOMM_UART_BAUDCON  = 0;    
00172                 
00173             MCOMM_UART_SPBRGL   = MCOMM_UART_SPBRGL_VALUE;
00174             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_SPBRGH_AVAILABLE)
00175             MCOMM_UART_SPBRGH   = MCOMM_UART_SPBRGH_VALUE;
00176             MCOMM_UART_BRG16    = MCOMM_UART_BRG16_VALUE;
00177             #endif
00178             MCOMM_UART_BRGH     = MCOMM_UART_BRGH_VALUE;
00179                         
00180             MCOMM_UART_TXEN     = 1;            // Enable transmission
00181             MCOMM_UART_SPEN     = 1;            // Enable serial port
00182             #if (MCOMM_TYPE != MCOMM_UART_ONE_WAY)
00183             MCOMM_UART_CREN     = 1;            // Enable continuous reception            
00184             MCOMM_UART_RCIE     = 1;            // Turn on UART Receive interrupts
00185             #endif
00186             MCOMM_UART_PEIE     = 1;            // Turn on peripheral interrupts
00187             
00188             #endif
00189             
00190         #elif defined(MCOMM_I2C_IMPLEMENTED)
00191     
00192                 //=============================
00193                 // Hardware I2C Initialization
00194                 //=============================
00195                 
00196             MCOMM_I2C_SSPSTAT = 0b10000000;     // SMP:     Slew rate control disabled for standard speed mode.
00197                                                 // CKE:     Disable SMBus specific inputs
00198             MCOMM_I2C_SSPCON1 = 0b00110110;     // WCOL:    Write Collision bit cleared
00199                                                 // SSPOV:   Receive Overflow bit cleared
00200                                                 // SSPEN:   Serial Port enabled
00201                                                 // CKP:     Clock line released
00202                                                 // SSPM:    I2C Slave mode, 7-bit address
00203             MCOMM_I2C_SSPCON2 = 0b00000001;     // GCEN:    General call disabled
00204                                                 // SEN:     Clock stretching is enabled for both slave transmit and slave receive
00205             MCOMM_I2C_SSPCON3 = 0b01000000;     // SCIE:    Start condition interrupt is disabled
00206                                                 // BOEN:    Buffer overwrite is disabled
00207                                                 // SDAHT:   Minimum of 100ns hold time on SDA after the falling edge of SCL
00208                                                 // SBCDE:   Slave mode bus collision detection interrupts are disabled
00209                                                 // AHEN:    Address holding disabled
00210                                                 // DHEN:    Data holding disabled
00211                                                 
00212             MCOMM_I2C_SSPMSK  = 0b11111110;     // Address Mask
00213             MCOMM_I2C_SSPADD  = MCOMM_I2C_ADDRESS;
00214             
00215             MCOMM_I2C_SSPIE   = 1;              // Turn on I2C slave interrupts
00216             MCOMM_I2C_PEIE    = 1;              // Turn on peripheral interrupts
00217         
00218             // NOTE:
00219             // SDA pin must be input
00220             // SCL pin must be input
00221         
00222         #elif defined(MCOMM_SPI_IMPLEMENTED)
00223         
00224             MCOMM_SPI_SSPSTAT = 0b00000000;     // SMP:     Cleared for slave mode
00225                                                 // CKE:     Tramsmit occurs on transition from idle to active clock state
00226                                                 // BF:      Buffer full bit cleared
00227             MCOMM_SPI_SSPCON1 = 0b00100100;     // WCOL:    Write Collection bit cleared
00228                                                 // SSPOV:   Receive overflow bit cleared
00229                                                 // SSPEN:   Serial Port enabled
00230                                                 // CKP:     Idle state for clock is low
00231                                                 // SSPM:    SPI Slave mode, nSS pin enabled
00232             MCOMM_SPI_SSPCON3 = 0b00000000;     // BOEN:    Buffer overwrite disabled
00233             
00234             MCOMM_SPI_SSPIE   = 1;              // Turn on SPI slave interrupts
00235             MCOMM_SPI_PEIE    = 1;              // Turn on peripheral interrupts
00236             
00237             // NOTE:
00238             // SDI pin must be input
00239             // SDO pin must be output
00240             // SCK pin must be input (slave)
00241             // nSS pin must be input
00242     
00243         #endif
00244     }
00245 
00246     
00247     
00248     
00249     #if defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00250     /*********************************************************************************
00251     *
00252     *             ____                              ____               _           
00253     *  _ __ ___  / ___|___  _ __ ___  _ __ ___     |  _ \ ___  ___ ___(_)_   _____ 
00254     * | '_ ` _ \| |   / _ \| '_ ` _ \| '_ ` _ \    | |_) / _ \/ __/ _ \ \ \ / / _ \
00255     * | | | | | | |__| (_) | | | | | | | | | | |   |  _ <  __/ (_|  __/ |\ V /  __/
00256     * |_| |_| |_|\____\___/|_| |_| |_|_| |_| |_|___|_| \_\___|\___\___|_| \_/ \___|
00257     *                                         |_____|   
00258     *
00259     *   This is the common function across all communication types that receives a
00260     *   new byte from the hardware module. The received bytes are stored in the
00261     *   input buffer and provided to the application only after a correct checksum
00262     *   has been evaluated.
00263     *********************************************************************************/
00264     void mComm_Receive()
00265     {
00266         uint8_t data;                                   // Stores the received byte
00267         
00268         
00269         
00270     #if defined(MCOMM_UART_IMPLEMENTED)
00271     
00272         //===========================
00273         //  _   _   _    ____ _____ 
00274         // | | | | / \  |  _ \_   _|
00275         // | | | |/ _ \ | |_) || |  
00276         // | |_| / ___ \|  _ < | |  
00277         //  \___/_/   \_\_| \_\|_|  
00278         //
00279         //===========================
00280         
00281         data = MCOMM_UART_RCREG;
00282         
00283         if ((data == 0x00) && (FERR == 1))
00284         {
00285             /**************************************************************
00286             * 1. 'Break' character received. Start of new packet.
00287             **************************************************************/
00288             mComm_input.state = MCOMM_START;
00289             return;
00290         }       
00291        
00292         if (MCOMM_UART_OERR)
00293         {
00294             /**************************************************************
00295             * UART overrun error has occurred. Reset the state machine and
00296             * the hardware module and then exit.
00297             **************************************************************/
00298             MCOMM_UART_CREN = 0;
00299             asm("NOP");
00300             asm("NOP");
00301             MCOMM_UART_CREN = 1;
00302             mComm_input.state = MCOMM_IDLE;
00303             return;
00304         }
00305         else if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_START)
00306         {
00307             /**************************************************************
00308             * 2. Get the byte count to determine the expected packet length
00309             *    and initialize the counter and index variables.
00310             **************************************************************/
00311             mComm_input.counter     = data;             // Store packet length
00312             mComm_input.index       = 0;                // Reset buffer index
00313             mComm_input.checksum    = 0;                // Reset checksum value
00314             mComm_input.state       = MCOMM_BUFFER;
00315             return;
00316         } 
00317         else if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_BUFFER)
00318         {
00319             /**************************************************************
00320             * 3. Knowing the packet length, buffer all incoming data. Also,
00321             *    keep a running calculation of the checksum.
00322             **************************************************************/
00323             mComm_input.buffer[mComm_input.index] = data;
00324 
00325             if (--mComm_input.counter == 0)
00326             {
00327                 mComm_input.state = MCOMM_PROCESS_DATA;
00328             } 
00329             else
00330             {  
00331                 mComm_input.index++;
00332             }
00333             mComm_input.checksum ^= data;
00334         }
00335         else
00336         {
00337             /**************************************************************
00338             * Invalid packet received. Reset the state machine.
00339             **************************************************************/
00340             mComm_input.state = MCOMM_IDLE;
00341             return;
00342         }
00343 
00344         
00345         if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_PROCESS_DATA)
00346         {
00347             /**************************************************************
00348             * 4. Complete packet received. Reset the state machine and set
00349             *    a flag to process the buffer's data.
00350             **************************************************************/
00351             if (mComm_input.checksum == 0)
00352             {
00353                 mComm_input.flags.bits.full = 1;
00354             }
00355             else
00356             {
00357                 mComm_input.flags.bits.invalid = 1;
00358             }
00359             mComm_input.state = MCOMM_IDLE;
00360         }
00361         
00362     // end - defined(MCOMM_UART_IMPLEMENTED)
00363     #elif defined(MCOMM_I2C_IMPLEMENTED)
00364     
00365    
00366         //===========================
00367         //  ___ ____   ____ 
00368         // |_ _|___ \ / ___|
00369         //  | |  __) | |    
00370         //  | | / __/| |___ 
00371         // |___|_____|\____|
00372         //
00373         //===========================
00374 
00375         MCOMM_I2C_SSPIF = 0;
00376         
00377         if (MCOMM_I2C_STOP)
00378         {
00379             if (mComm_input.flags.bits.write)   // If we've stopped after a write
00380             {                                   //  request, execute the write.
00381                 /**************************************************************
00382                 * Packet complete. Validate checksum, then provide the data 
00383                 * to the application layer.
00384                 **************************************************************/
00385                 if (mComm_input.checksum == 0)
00386                 {
00387                     MCOMM_I2C_SSPADD = MCOMM_I2C_ADDRESS_BUSY;  // Change I2C Address to stop writes
00388                     
00389                     mComm_Process(mComm_input.buffer[0]);       // Write Response
00390                     while (mComm_output.iterator());            // Execute writes
00391                     
00392                     MCOMM_I2C_SSPADD = MCOMM_I2C_ADDRESS;       // Change I2C Address back on
00393                 }
00394             }
00395         }
00396         else if (MCOMM_I2C_RnW)          // Read or Write?
00397         {   
00398         
00399             mComm_input.flags.bits.write = 0;       // Set 'read' flag.    
00400             
00401             if (mComm_input.checksum == 0)          // Respond only if 'write' request
00402             {                                       //  checksum is valid.
00403             
00404                 if (!MCOMM_I2C_DnA)                 // Special case: Address Byte
00405                 {
00406                     /**************************************************************
00407                     * Read Address
00408                     *   This code is executed if the master sent a read address
00409                     *   in the last byte of the communication. Using this to
00410                     *   initialize variables for the new output stream.
00411                     **************************************************************/
00412                     mComm_output.checksum   = 0;
00413                     mComm_Process(mComm_input.buffer[0]);
00414                 }
00415                 
00416                 /**************************************************************
00417                 * Read 
00418                 *   This code is executed to output the requested data to the
00419                 *   master. The pointer has already been set up, so this code
00420                 *   simply outputs it until the byteCounter reaches zero.
00421                 **************************************************************/
00422                 if (mComm_output.flags.bits.hasNext)  
00423                 {
00424                     data = mComm_output.iterator();     // Get next output value
00425                     mComm_output.checksum ^= data;      // Update checksum calculation
00426                 } else {
00427                     data = mComm_output.checksum;       // Last byte sent is checksum
00428                 }
00429                 
00430                 do {
00431                     MCOMM_I2C_WCOL = 0;     // Clear write-collision flag
00432                     
00433                     // Output data to I2C bus
00434                     if (!MCOMM_I2C_CKP)     
00435                         MCOMM_I2C_SSPBUF = data;
00436                         
00437                 } while (MCOMM_I2C_WCOL);   // Retry if failed until successful
00438 
00439             } // end: Valid Checksum
00440         }
00441         else        // Read or Write?   Write.
00442         {         
00443 
00444             mComm_input.flags.bits.write = 1;
00445         
00446             if (MCOMM_I2C_DnA)              
00447             {                           
00448                 
00449                 /**************************************************************
00450                 * Write Data
00451                 *   This state is called when we are receiving data from the
00452                 *   master. This might be an opcode, an address, a payload
00453                 *   value, or a checksum.
00454                 **************************************************************/
00455                 data = MCOMM_I2C_SSPBUF;                        // Store the received data
00456                 mComm_input.buffer[mComm_input.index] = data;   // Insert into buffer
00457                 mComm_input.checksum ^= data;                   // Update checksum
00458                 mComm_input.index++;                            // Increment index
00459                 
00460             }
00461             else                            
00462             {                           
00463             
00464                 /**************************************************************
00465                 * Write Address
00466                 *   This state is called when a new packet is being received.
00467                 **************************************************************/
00468                 mComm_input.index       = 0;    // Reset the packet's byte counter
00469                 mComm_input.checksum    = 0;    // Reset the packet's checksum value
00470                 data = MCOMM_I2C_SSPBUF;        // Store the received I2C address to clear SSPBUF
00471                 
00472             }   // end DnA
00473             
00474         }   // end RnW
00475         
00476         MCOMM_I2C_SSPOV = 0;    // Clearing overflow flag
00477         MCOMM_I2C_CKP = 1;      // Stop clock stretching and allow
00478                                 //    the master to begin clocking
00479                                 //    out the new data in SSPBUF.
00480 
00481         
00482     // end - defined(MCOMM_I2C_IMPLEMENTED)
00483     #elif defined(MCOMM_SPI_IMPLEMENTED)
00484     
00485         //===========================
00486         //  ____  ____ ___ 
00487         // / ___||  _ \_ _|
00488         // \___ \| |_) | | 
00489         //  ___) |  __/| | 
00490         // |____/|_|  |___|
00491         // 
00492         //===========================    
00493         
00494         MCOMM_SPI_SSPIF = 0;
00495         data = MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF;
00496         
00497         if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_START)
00498         {
00499             /**************************************************************
00500             * 1. 'CS' pin just activated. Start of new packet.
00501             **************************************************************/
00502             if (data == MCOMM_SPI_ADDRESS)  {   mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_PACKET_LENGTH;   MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF = MCOMM_OP_ACK;    }
00503             else                            {   mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_IDLE;            MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF = data;            }
00504             return;
00505         }
00506         else if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_PACKET_LENGTH)
00507         {
00508             /**************************************************************
00509             * 2. Store the length of the packet and initialize the packet data.
00510             **************************************************************/
00511             mComm_input.state       = MCOMM_SPI_BUFFER;
00512             mComm_input.counter     = data;             // Store packet length
00513             mComm_input.index       = 0;                // Reset buffer index
00514             mComm_input.checksum    = 0;                // Reset checksum value
00515             MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF        = 0x00;
00516             return;
00517         }
00518         else if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_BUFFER)
00519         {
00520             /**************************************************************
00521             * 3. Knowing the packet length, buffer all incoming data. Also,
00522             *    keep a running calculation of the checksum.
00523             **************************************************************/
00524             mComm_input.buffer[mComm_input.index] = data;
00525 
00526             if (--mComm_input.counter == 0)
00527             {
00528                 mComm_input.state   = MCOMM_SPI_PROCESS_DATA;
00529             } 
00530             else
00531             {  
00532                 mComm_input.index++;
00533             }
00534             mComm_input.checksum ^= data;
00535         }
00536         else if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_IDLE)
00537         {
00538             /**************************************************************
00539             * Invalid packet. 
00540             **************************************************************/
00541             MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF    = data;
00542             return;
00543         }
00544 
00545         
00546         if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_PROCESS_DATA)
00547         {
00548             /**************************************************************
00549             * 4. Complete packet received. Reset the state machine and 
00550             *    process the buffer's data.
00551             **************************************************************/
00552             if (mComm_input.checksum == 0)
00553             {
00554                 mComm_Process(mComm_input.buffer[0]);
00555                 
00556                 if (!(mComm_input.buffer[0] & 0x01))        // If 'write' command
00557                 {
00558                     while (mComm_output.iterator());        // Execute writes    
00559                     MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF    = MCOMM_OP_ACK;     // Output 0xAA
00560                     mComm_input.state   = MCOMM_SPI_IDLE;   // Reset state machine
00561                     return;
00562                 }
00563                 mComm_input.state = MCOMM_SPI_OUTPUT;       // If 'read' command, output data
00564             }
00565         }
00566         
00567         if (mComm_input.state == MCOMM_SPI_OUTPUT)
00568         {
00569             /**************************************************************
00570             * 5. Master is expecting data. Find the next byte to output
00571             *    and place it in the SSP module's buffer register.
00572             **************************************************************/
00573 
00574             if (mComm_output.flags.bits.hasNext)  
00575             {
00576                 data = mComm_output.iterator();
00577                 mComm_output.checksum ^= data;
00578             } else {
00579                 data = mComm_output.checksum;
00580             }
00581             
00582             do {
00583                 MCOMM_SPI_WCOL = 0;         // Clear write-collision flag
00584                 MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF = data;    // Output data to SPI bus
00585             } while (MCOMM_SPI_WCOL);       // Retry if failed until successful
00586 
00587             MCOMM_SPI_SSPOV = 0;            // Clearing overflow flag
00588             return;
00589         }
00590         
00591         MCOMM_SPI_SSPBUF    = 0x00;
00592         
00593     #endif // end - defined(MCOMM_SPI_IMPLEMENTED)
00594     }
00595     
00596     
00597     #if defined(MCOMM_SPI_IMPLEMENTED)
00598     void mComm_SPI_ServiceSS(void)
00599     {
00600         if (MCOMM_SPI_IOCIF)
00601         {
00602             MCOMM_SPI_IOCIF  = 0;
00603             if (mComm_input.flags.bits.ssLatch != MCOMM_SPI_SS_PIN)     // Latch does not match actual value
00604             {
00605                 if (mComm_input.flags.bits.ssLatch == 1)                // If we were not selected, but now are
00606                     mComm_input.state = MCOMM_SPI_START;                // Begin a new packet
00607                     
00608                 mComm_input.flags.bits.ssLatch = MCOMM_SPI_SS_PIN;      // Reset latch value
00609             }
00610         }
00611     }
00612     #endif // end - defined(MCOMM_SPI_IMPLEMENTED)
00613     
00614     #endif // end - defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00615     
00616 
00617     /*********************************************************************************
00618     *
00619     *             ____                              ____                  _          
00620     *  _ __ ___  / ___|___  _ __ ___  _ __ ___     / ___|  ___ _ ____   _(_) ___ ___ 
00621     * | '_ ` _ \| |   / _ \| '_ ` _ \| '_ ` _ \    \___ \ / _ \ '__\ \ / / |/ __/ _ \
00622     * | | | | | | |__| (_) | | | | | | | | | | |    ___) |  __/ |   \ V /| | (_|  __/
00623     * |_| |_| |_|\____\___/|_| |_| |_|_| |_| |_|___|____/ \___|_|    \_/ |_|\___\___|
00624     *                                         |_____| 
00625     *
00626     *   When implementing the mComm module through the UART, this
00627     *   service function should be called to process any fully-
00628     *   received packets and output the stream if the 'enabled'
00629     *   and 'go' bits are set in its configuration register.
00630     *********************************************************************************/
00631     #if defined(MCOMM_UART_IMPLEMENTED)
00632     void mComm_Service()
00633     {
00634     
00635         //===========================
00636         //  _   _   _    ____ _____ 
00637         // | | | | / \  |  _ \_   _|
00638         // | | | |/ _ \ | |_) || |  
00639         // | |_| / ___ \|  _ < | |  
00640         //  \___/_/   \_\_| \_\|_|  
00641         //
00642         //===========================
00643         #if defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00644         union
00645         {
00646             uint8_t     all;
00647             
00648             struct 
00649             {
00650                 unsigned R_nW           :1;
00651                 unsigned processInput   :1;
00652                 unsigned invalidInput   :1;
00653                 unsigned run            :1;
00654                 #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_OPCODE)
00655                 unsigned processCustom  :1;
00656                 #endif
00657             } flags;
00658         } mode;                         // This temporary structure holds all
00659                                         //  flags for this function in 8-bits.
00660 
00661         uint8_t data;        
00662         mode.all = 0;                   // Clear all flags.
00663         
00664         if (mComm_input.flags.bits.invalid == 1)                    //===========================
00665         {                                                           // Invalid Packet
00666             mComm_input.flags.all = 0;                              //===========================
00667             mComm_UART_SendACKorNACK(MCOMM_OP_NACK);                // NACK
00668         }
00669       
00670         #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM)
00671         if (mComm_streamConfig.go && mComm_streamConfig.enabled)    //===========================
00672         {                                                           // Stream ready for output
00673             mode.flags.run              = 1;                        //===========================
00674             mode.flags.R_nW             = 1;  
00675         }
00676         #endif
00677         
00678         #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_OPCODE)                     
00679         if (MCOMM_CUSTOM_CALLBACK())                                //================================
00680         {                                                           // Custom packet ready for output
00681             mode.flags.run              = 1;                        //================================
00682             mode.flags.R_nW             = 1;
00683             mode.flags.processCustom    = 1;
00684         }
00685         #endif
00686         
00687         if (mComm_input.flags.bits.full)                            //================================
00688         {                                                           // Input ready for processing
00689             mode.flags.run              = 1;                        //================================
00690             mode.flags.R_nW             = mComm_input.buffer[0] & 0x01;
00691             mode.flags.processInput     = 1;
00692             #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_OPCODE)
00693             mode.flags.processCustom    = 0;
00694             #endif
00695         }
00696       
00697         if (mode.flags.run)     // If there is something to be output by the UART...
00698         {
00699             //=============================
00700             // Initialize the Iterator
00701             //=============================
00702             #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM) || defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_OPCODE)
00703             if (mode.flags.processInput)
00704             {
00705             #endif
00706                 mComm_Process(mComm_input.buffer[0]);
00707             #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM) || defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_OPCODE)
00708             }
00709             else
00710             {
00711                 #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM) && defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_OPCODE)
00712                 if (mode.flags.processCustom)
00713                 {
00714                     mComm_Process(MCOMM_OP_CUSTOM_READ);
00715                 } else {
00716                     mComm_Process(MCOMM_OP_STREAM_READ);
00717                 }
00718                 #else
00719                     #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM)
00720                     mComm_Process(MCOMM_OP_STREAM_READ);
00721                     #else
00722                     mComm_Process(MCOMM_OP_CUSTOM_READ);
00723                     #endif
00724                 #endif
00725             }
00726             #endif
00727         
00728             //=============================
00729             // Execute
00730             //=============================
00731             if (mode.flags.R_nW)    // Read
00732             {
00733                 mComm_output.checksum = 0;
00734             
00735                 if (mComm_output.flags.bits.hasNext)        // Send BREAK character
00736                 {
00737                     MCOMM_UART_SENDB = 1;
00738                     MCOMM_UART_TXREG = 0x00;
00739                     while(MCOMM_UART_SENDB);
00740                 }
00741                 
00742                 while (mComm_output.flags.bits.hasNext)     // Execute reads. Send data.
00743                 {
00744                     data = mComm_output.iterator();             
00745                     mComm_UART_PutChar(data);
00746                     if (mComm_output.flags.bits.second == 0)
00747                     {
00748                         mComm_output.checksum ^= data;
00749                     }
00750                 }
00751                 mComm_UART_PutChar(mComm_output.checksum);  // Send checksum.
00752             }
00753             else    // Write
00754             {
00755                 while (mComm_output.iterator());            // Execute writes.
00756                 mComm_UART_SendACKorNACK(MCOMM_OP_ACK);     // Send ACK.
00757             }
00758             
00759             //=============================
00760             // Clean-Up
00761             //=============================
00762             #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM)
00763             if (mode.flags.processInput)
00764             {
00765             #endif
00766                 mComm_input.flags.bits.full = 0;            // Reset 'full' input buffer flag
00767             #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM)
00768             }
00769             else
00770             {
00771                 #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM) && defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_CUSTOM_OPCODE)
00772                 if (!mode.flags.processCustom)
00773                 {
00774                     mComm_streamConfig.go = 0;              // Reset 'go' stream flag
00775                 }
00776                 #else
00777                     #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLE_STREAM)
00778                     mComm_streamConfig.go = 0;
00779                     #endif
00780                 #endif
00781             }
00782             #endif
00783         }
00784         #endif // end - defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00785         
00786         #if defined(MCOMM_ONE_WAY_ENABLED)
00787         
00788             
00789             // OUTPUT LOGIC FOR ONE-WAY COMMUNICATIONS.
00790             
00791             // mComm_UART_Int2ASCII()  converts a 16-bit value to ASCII and outputs it using mComm_UART_PutChar()
00792             // mComm_UART_Char2ASCII() converts an 8-bit value to ASCII and outputs it using mComm_UART_PutChar()
00793             
00794             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_STATE)
00795             mComm_UART_Int2ASCII((uint16_t)mTouch_stateMask);
00796             #else
00797             mComm_UART_Int2ASCII(0);
00798             #endif
00799             
00800             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_TOGGLE) && defined(MTOUCH_TOGGLE_ENABLED)
00801             mComm_UART_Int2ASCII((uint16_t)mTouch_toggle);
00802             #else
00803             mComm_UART_Int2ASCII(0);
00804             #endif
00805             
00806             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_SLIDER) && defined(MTOUCH_NUMBER_OF_SLIDERS) && (MTOUCH_NUMBER_OF_SLIDERS > 0)
00807             mComm_UART_Char2ASCII(mTouch_slider[0]);            
00808             #else
00809             mComm_UART_Char2ASCII(0);
00810             #endif
00811 
00812             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_MATRIX) && defined(MTOUCH_MATRIX_ENABLED)
00813             mComm_UART_PutChar('(');
00814             if (mTouch_Matrix_isPressed())
00815             {
00816                 mComm_UART_PutChar((uint8_t)(mTouch_Matrix_getColumn()) + 0x30);
00817                 mComm_UART_PutChar(':');
00818                 mComm_UART_PutChar((uint8_t)(mTouch_Matrix_getRow())    + 0x30);
00819             }
00820             else
00821             {
00822                 mComm_UART_PutChar('x');
00823                 mComm_UART_PutChar(':');
00824                 mComm_UART_PutChar('x');
00825             }
00826             mComm_UART_PutChar(')');
00827             mComm_UART_PutChar(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_DELIMITER);
00828             #endif
00829             
00830             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_READING) || defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_BASELINE)
00831             for (uint8_t i = 0; i < MTOUCH_NUMBER_SENSORS; i++)
00832             {
00833                 #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_READING)
00834                 mComm_UART_Int2ASCII(mTouch_GetSensor(i));      
00835                 #endif                                          
00836                 #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_BASELINE)
00837                 mComm_UART_Int2ASCII(mTouch_GetAverage(i));     
00838                 #endif
00839             }
00840             #endif
00841             
00842             mComm_UART_PutChar(0x0D);   // CR                   
00843             mComm_UART_PutChar(0x0A);   // LF
00844         
00845         #endif
00846     }
00847     #endif // end - defined(MCOMM_UART_IMPLEMENTED)
00848 
00849     
00850     #if defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00851     /*********************************************************************************
00852     *             ____                              ____                              
00853     *  _ __ ___  / ___|___  _ __ ___  _ __ ___     |  _ \ _ __ ___   ___ ___  ___ ___ 
00854     * | '_ ` _ \| |   / _ \| '_ ` _ \| '_ ` _ \    | |_) | '__/ _ \ / __/ _ \/ __/ __|
00855     * | | | | | | |__| (_) | | | | | | | | | | |   |  __/| | | (_) | (_|  __/\__ \__ \
00856     * |_| |_| |_|\____\___/|_| |_| |_|_| |_| |_|___|_|   |_|  \___/ \___\___||___/___/
00857     *                                         |_____|            
00858     *
00859     *   Interprets the master's request (stored in the input buffer), initializes 
00860     *   the output structure, and iterator variables.
00861     *
00862     *   This is performed using a lookup table of function pointers with the opcode
00863     *   parameter behaving as the index of the lookup. 
00864     *********************************************************************************/
00865     void mComm_Process(uint8_t opcode)
00866     {    
00867         //=============================
00868         // Valid Opcode
00869         //=============================
00870         if (opcode < MCOMM_NUMBER_OPCODES)              
00871         {
00872             mComm_output.flags.all          = 0x00;     // Reset output vector's flags
00873             mComm_output.flags.bits.first   = 1;
00874             mComm_output.flags.bits.hasNext = 1;
00875             
00876             mComm_output.counter    = 0;                // Reset output vector's variables
00877             mComm_output.latch      = 0;
00878             mComm_output.opcode     = opcode;
00879             mComm_output.iterator   = mComm_opcode[opcode].iterator;
00880             
00881             mComm_opcode[opcode].initialize();          // Initialize the iterator
00882             return;
00883         }
00884         
00885         //=============================
00886         // Invalid Opcode
00887         //=============================
00888         mComm_output.iterator = &mComm_ErrorIterator;   
00889     }
00890     #endif // end - defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00891     
00892     
00893     /*********************************************************************************
00894     *  _   _      _                   _____                 _   _                 
00895     * | | | | ___| |_ __   ___ _ __  |  ___|   _ _ __   ___| |_(_) ___  _ __  ___ 
00896     * | |_| |/ _ \ | '_ \ / _ \ '__| | |_ | | | | '_ \ / __| __| |/ _ \| '_ \/ __|
00897     * |  _  |  __/ | |_) |  __/ |    |  _|| |_| | | | | (__| |_| | (_) | | | \__ \
00898     * |_| |_|\___|_| .__/ \___|_|    |_|   \__,_|_| |_|\___|\__|_|\___/|_| |_|___/
00899     *              |_|                                              
00900     *********************************************************************************/
00901     #if defined(MCOMM_UART_IMPLEMENTED)
00902     
00903         #if defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)
00904         void mComm_UART_SendACKorNACK(uint8_t opcode)
00905         {
00906             while(MCOMM_UART_TXIF == 0);  
00907             MCOMM_UART_SENDB = 1;
00908             MCOMM_UART_TXREG = 0x00;
00909             while(MCOMM_UART_SENDB);        // BREAK
00910             mComm_UART_PutChar(0x02);       // Packet Length
00911             mComm_UART_PutChar(opcode);     // Acknowledge
00912             mComm_UART_PutChar(opcode);     // Checksum
00913         }    
00914         #endif
00915         
00916         // Performs the steps required to output 8-bits of data to the Tx pin of the
00917         //  microcontroller. If a UART hardware module is being used, this is simple.
00918         //  If the software will be bit-banging the data, the timing is critical so
00919         //  an assembly-coded list of instructions will run the output.
00920         void mComm_UART_PutChar(uint8_t data)
00921         {
00922             #if defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED) || (MCOMM_UART_1WAY_MODULE == MCOMM_UART_HARDWARE_MODULE)
00923             
00924                 while(MCOMM_UART_TXIF == 0);     
00925                 MCOMM_UART_TXREG = data;
00926                 
00927             #else
00928                 
00929                 #pragma regsused mComm_UART_PutChar wreg status fsr0
00930                 
00931                 mComm_shiftReg = data;   
00932                 
00933                 #if defined(_PIC14E)        // Implementation if using an enhanced-core PIC16F1 device
00934                 asm("   movlw LOW  " ___mkstr(NOBANK(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPORT)));
00935                 asm("   movwf      " ___mkstr(FSR0L)                 );
00936                 asm("   movlw HIGH " ___mkstr(NOBANK(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPORT)));
00937                 asm("   movwf      " ___mkstr(FSR0H)                 ); 
00938                 asm("   BANKSEL    _mComm_bitCount                  "); 
00939                 asm("   movlw      0x08                             "); 
00940                 asm("   movwf      _mComm_bitCount                  "); 
00941                 asm("   bcf        " ___mkstr(INDF0) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));                                 
00942                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
00943                 asm("   ljmp       $+1                              "); 
00944                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
00945                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXNEXTBIT:                          "); 
00946                 asm("   rrf        _mComm_shiftReg, F               "); 
00947                 asm("   btfss      " ___mkstr(NOBANK(STATUS))   ", 0"); 
00948                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXZERO                "); 
00949                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXONE:                              "); 
00950                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
00951                 asm("   bsf        " ___mkstr(INDF0) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));
00952                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
00953                 asm("   decfsz     _mComm_bitCount, F               "); 
00954                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXNEXTBIT             "); 
00955                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXSTOP                "); 
00956                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXZERO:                             "); 
00957                 asm("   bcf        " ___mkstr(INDF0) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));                    
00958                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
00959                 asm("   decfsz     _mComm_bitCount, F               "); 
00960                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXNEXTBIT             "); 
00961                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXSTOP                "); 
00962                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXSTOP:                             "); 
00963                 asm("   ljmp       $+1                              "); 
00964                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
00965                 asm("   bsf        " ___mkstr(INDF0) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));
00966                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
00967                 asm("   return                                      "); 
00968                 asm("MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY:                           "); 
00969                 asm("   movlw      0x04                             "); 
00970                 asm("   sublw      " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_FWBRG_VALUE)); 
00971                 asm("   movwf      _mComm_delayCount                "); 
00972                 asm("MCOMM_UART_BITWAITLOOP:                        "); 
00973                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
00974                 asm("MCOMM_UART_BITWAIT:                            "); 
00975                 asm("   decfsz     _mComm_delayCount, F             "); 
00976                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_BITWAITLOOP           "); 
00977                 asm("   ljmp       $+1                              "); 
00978                 asm("   return                                      "); 
00979                 #elif defined(_PIC14)       // Implementation if using a non-enhanced core PIC12/16F device                                          
00980                 asm("   movlw LOW  "   ___mkstr(NOBANK(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPORT))); 
00981                 asm("   movwf      "   ___mkstr(FSR)                 ); 
00982                 asm("   BANKSEL    _mComm_shiftReg                  "); 
00983                 asm("   movlw      8                                "); 
00984                 asm("   movwf      _mComm_bitCount                  "); 
00985                 asm("   bcf " ___mkstr(INDF) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));                                          
00986                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
00987                 asm("   ljmp       $+1                              "); 
00988                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
00989                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXNEXTBIT:                          "); 
00990                 asm("   rrf    _mComm_shiftReg, F                   "); 
00991                 asm("   btfss  "   ___mkstr(NOBANK(STATUS))    ", 0"); 
00992                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXZERO                "); 
00993                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXONE:                              "); 
00994                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
00995                 asm("   bsf " ___mkstr(INDF) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));                      
00996                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
00997                 asm("   decfsz     _mComm_bitCount, F        "); 
00998                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXNEXTBIT             "); 
00999                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXSTOP                "); 
01000                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXZERO:                             "); 
01001                 asm("   bcf " ___mkstr(INDF) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));                          
01002                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
01003                 asm("   decfsz     _mComm_bitCount, F        "); 
01004                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXNEXTBIT             "); 
01005                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_TXSTOP                "); 
01006                 asm("MCOMM_UART_TXSTOP:                             "); 
01007                 asm("   ljmp       $+1                              "); 
01008                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
01009                 asm("   bsf " ___mkstr(INDF) ", " ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_SOFT_TXPIN));                            
01010                 asm("   fcall      MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY              "); 
01011                 asm("   return                                      "); 
01012                 asm("MCOMM_UART_BITDELAY:                           "); 
01013                 asm("   movlw      4                                "); 
01014                 asm("   sublw  "   ___mkstr(MCOMM_UART_FWBRG_VALUE)  ); 
01015                 asm("   movwf      _mComm_delayCount                "); 
01016                 asm("MCOMM_UART_BITWAITLOOP:                        "); 
01017                 asm("   nop                                         "); 
01018                 asm("MCOMM_UART_BITWAIT:                            "); 
01019                 asm("   decfsz     _mComm_delayCount, F             "); 
01020                 asm("   ljmp       MCOMM_UART_BITWAITLOOP           "); 
01021                 asm("   ljmp       $+1                              "); 
01022                 asm("   return                                      "); 
01023                 #endif
01024                 
01025             #endif
01026         }
01027         
01028         #if (MCOMM_TYPE == MCOMM_UART_ONE_WAY)
01029         // Converts an 8-bit value into ASCII and then uses the mComm_UART_PutChar() 
01030         //  function to transmit it to the master. A delimiter character is added to
01031         //  the end automatically.
01032         void mComm_UART_Char2ASCII(uint8_t output)
01033         {
01034             #if (MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUTPUT == MCOMM_UART_1WAY_HEX)
01035             
01036                 uint8_t nibble;
01037             
01038                 #define MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(value, shift)                      \
01039                     nibble = (uint8_t) value >> shift;                              \
01040                     if (nibble <= 9) { nibble += 0x30; } else { nibble += 0x37; }   \
01041                     mComm_UART_PutChar(nibble);
01042                     
01043                 MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(output, 4);
01044                 MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(output, 0);
01045                 
01046                 #undef MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE
01047                 
01048             #else
01049             
01050                 uint8_t digit = 0;
01051                 while (output >= 100)  { output -= 100; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30); digit = 0;
01052                 while (output >=  10)  { output -=  10; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30); digit = 0;
01053                 while (output >=   1)  { output -=   1; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30);
01054                 
01055             #endif
01056             
01057             #if defined(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUT_GUIv1_1)
01058             mComm_UART_PutChar(',');
01059             #else
01060             mComm_UART_PutChar(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_DELIMITER);
01061             #endif
01062         }
01063         
01064         
01065         // Converts a 16-bit value into ASCII and then uses the mComm_UART_PutChar() 
01066         //  function to transmit it to the master. A delimiter character is added to
01067         //  the end automatically.
01068         void mComm_UART_Int2ASCII(uint16_t output)
01069         {
01070             
01071             #if (MCOMM_UART_1WAY_OUTPUT == MCOMM_UART_1WAY_HEX)
01072                 
01073                 uint8_t nibble;
01074             
01075                 #define MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(value, shift)                      \
01076                     nibble = (uint8_t) value >> shift;                              \
01077                     if (nibble <= 9) { nibble += 0x30; } else { nibble += 0x37; }   \
01078                     mComm_UART_PutChar(nibble);
01079             
01080                 MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(output, 12);
01081                 MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(output, 8);
01082                 MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(output, 4);
01083                 MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE(output, 0);
01084                 
01085                 #undef MCOMM_UART_OUTPUT_NIBBLE
01086                 
01087             #else
01088             
01089                 uint8_t digit = 0;
01090                 while (output >= 10000) { output -= 10000; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30); digit = 0;
01091                 while (output >=  1000) { output -=  1000; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30); digit = 0;
01092                 while (output >=   100) { output -=   100; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30); digit = 0;
01093                 while (output >=    10) { output -=    10; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30); digit = 0;
01094                 while (output >=     1) { output -=     1; digit++; } mComm_UART_PutChar(digit + 0x30);
01095                 
01096             #endif
01097             
01098             mComm_UART_PutChar(MCOMM_UART_1WAY_DELIMITER);
01099         }
01100         
01101         #endif
01102         
01103         
01104     #endif
01105     
01106 #endif
